document.docTitle: Pagurixus pseliophorus Komai & Osawa 2006, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Pagurixus boninensis species group, with descriptions of six new species (Crustacea: Decapoda: Anomura: Paguridae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the Pagurixus boninensis species group, with descriptions of six new species (Crustacea: Decapoda: Anomura: Paguridae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Natural History Museum and Institute, Chiba, 955 - 2 Aoba-cho, Chuo-ku, Chiba 260 - 8682, Japan.

subSubSection.paragraph: HOLOTYPE : CBM­ZC 7856, male (SL 2.8 mm ), Ahra beach, Kume­jima Island, Ryukyu Islands, intertidal reef flat, coll. K. Nomura, 15 June 1995 .

PARATYPES : CBM­ZC 7857, 2 females (SL 2.1, 2.2 mm ), same data as holotype; CBM­ZC 7858, 1 female (SL 4.2 mm ), Hane­misaki , Kochi Prefecture , intertidal, coll. S. Wada ,
26 April 2001
;
CBM­ZC 8533, 1 male (SL 3.3 mm ), Saga, Kochi Prefecture ,
0–1 m
, coll. H. Matsui ,
23 July 2005
;
CMNH­ZC 1874 , 1 male (SL 3.4 mm ), Akino­hama , Izu­oshima Island , Izu Islands ,
2 m
,
SCUBA diving, coll. H. Arima ,
29 January 2005
;
CMNH­ZC 1876 , same locality, coll. H. Arima ,
1 March 2005
;
CMNH­ZC , 2 ovigerous females (SL 2.8, 4.3 mm ), same locality, coll. H. Arima & J. Okuno ,
11 July 2005
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 36.
Pagurixus pseliophorus
n. sp.
Holotype male (SL 2.8 mm) from Kume­jima Island (CBM­ZC 7856). A, shield and cephalic appendages, dorsal view; B, left antennule, lateral view; C, ultimate segment of left antennular peduncle, ventral view; D, left fourth pereopod, dactylus and propodus, lateral view; E, same, mesial view; F, right fourth pereopod, dactylus and propodus, lateral view; G, sixth thoracic sternite, ventral view; H, coxae of fifth pereopods and eighth thoracic sternite, ventral view; I, telson, dorsal view. Scale bars: 1 mm for A; 0.5 mm for B–I.

FIGURE 37.
Pagurixus pseliophorus
n. sp.
Holotype male (SL 2.8 mm) from Kume­jima Island (CBM­ZC 7856). Right cheliped. A, chela, dorsal view; B, entire right cheliped, mesial view; C, same, lateral view; D, carpus, dorsal view. Scale bar: 1 mm.

FIGURE 38.
Pagurixus pseliophorus
n. sp.
A–C, paratype ovigerous female (SL 2.2 mm) from Kume­jima Island (CBM­ZC 7857); D, paratype female (SL 4.2 mm) from Hane­misaki, Kochi Prefecture; E–G, holotype male (SL 2.8 mm) from Kume­jima Island (CBM­ZC 7856). A, right cheliped, chela and carpus, dorsal view; B, entire right cheliped, mesial view; C, same, lateral view; D, carpus of right cheliped, mesial view; E, left cheliped, chela and carpus, dorsal view; F, entire left cheliped, mesial view; G, same, lateral view. Scale bars: 0.5 mm.

FIGURE 39.
Pagurixus pseliophorus
n. sp.
Holotype male (SL 2.8 mm) from Kume­jima Island (CBM­ZC 7856). A, right second pereopod, lateral view; B, left third pereopod, lateral view; C, right second pereopod, dactylus and distal part of propodus, mesial view; D, left third pereopod, dactylus and distal part of propodus, mesial view. Scale bar: 1 mm for A, B; 0.5 mm for D, E.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Known only from the Ryukyu and Izu Islands and Kochi Prefecture , Japan ( Fig. 48 ); intertidal to
2 m
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Pagurixus pseliophorus
closely resembles
P. brachydactylus
n. sp.
in the short and stout ambulatory dactyli. Morphological differences between the two species are summarized in Table 2 , and discussed under the account of
P. brachydactylus
n. sp.
From the Greek pseliophoros , carrying a bracelet, in reference to the brown bands on the ambulatory legs.
